title: WASH and Sanitation Survey in Community-Based Childcare Centres – Thyolo and Chikwawa, Malawi (2021)
text: dataset provides detailed information Water, Sanitation, Hygiene (WASH) conditions related management practices Community-Based Childcare Centres (CBCCs) across Thyolo Chikwawa Districts Malawi, collected 2021. Data gathered BASEflow using mWater digital data collection platform. dataset contains metadata survey, including geographical location CBCCs, water sources functionality, sanitation infrastructure, hygiene practices, governance management structures, funding mechanisms, cleanliness levels, availability hygiene education promotional materials. Intended Users Applications Local Government Health Authorities: monitor WASH conditions, inform resource allocation, design targeted interventions within Thyolo’s CBCCs. CBCC Management Caregivers: identify gaps improve maintenance, hygiene practices, infrastructure. NGOs Development Partners: support planning, implementation, evaluation WASH programs aligned community needs standards. Researchers Policy Makers: study relationship WASH facilities child health outcomes evidence-based decision-making. Donors Funders: assess infrastructure needs measure impact funded WASH initiatives.

code: library(thyolocbcc) library(forcats) library(ggplot2)  # Create a bar chart of water source types, displaying NA as "Other" ggplot(thyolocbcc, aes(x = fct_explicit_na(main_water_source, na_level = "Other"))) +   geom_bar(fill = "#1f78b4") +   labs(title = "Main Water Source Types Across CBCCs",        x = "Water Source Type",        y = "Number of CBCCs") +   theme_minimal() +   # Rotate x-axis labels for better readability   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) #Pie Chart: Percentage of CBCCs with Year-Round Water Availability  # Prepare data for pie chart year_round <- thyolocbcc %>%   # Filter out rows where water availability data is missing   filter(!is.na(water_available_year_round)) %>%      # Count the number of CBCCs for each water availability category (Yes/No)   count(water_available_year_round) %>%      # Calculate percentage and create a label for each slice   mutate(     percent = round(100 * n / sum(n), 1),  # Percent of total     label = paste0(water_available_year_round, " (", percent, "%)")  # Text label for the pie chart   )  # Create pie chart ggplot(year_round, aes(x = "", y = n, fill = water_available_year_round)) +   # Create a stacked bar chart with white borders(to become pie slices)   geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +      # Convert the stacked bar into a circular pie chart   coord_polar(theta = "y") +      # Add percentage labels inside each slice   geom_text(aes(label = label),             position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5),             color = "white", size = 4) +      # Add chart title and remove other axis elements   labs(title = "Year-Round Water Availability at CBCCs") +   theme_void() +      # Use a nice color palette for the slices   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2")
